name: Hotel Principe Di Savoia

reviews.text: I was part of a big group travelling. Having visited the rooms of the rest of my friends, I would say my room on the 9th floor was one of the nicest. Spacious, newly refurbished, but still with the charms of the history. Great gym - small but adequate, though they close at 10pm - a little early in my opinion. Did not get to try out the heated pool, but definitely looks inviting.
reviews.title: Everything you expect in a 5 star hotel

reviews.text: I know all good hotels comes with a price tag, but 6 Euros for a thermal flask of hot water seems quite outrageous, especially since it is not uncommon for rooms to provide a hot water flask. And a whole fruit tart cost 300 Euros at the bar. (!!!)
reviews.title: Milan's #1 Hotel

reviews.text: The staffs were polite and professional, but not really warm and welcoming. As one of the drivers explained, it is northern Italy - people tend to be this way in general.
reviews.title: Sister get away!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a good, comfortable stay with very professional and polite services, but the lack of warmth and hospitality makes it un-deserving of a full 5 out of 5 rating.
reviews.title: Service, service, service

reviews.text: As of this writing, the Principe is rated in the top 10 of Milan hotels but there is no way there is a better property. The service standards are simply the best I've experienced in Europe and the property is beautiful in every way, just like the bustling city that it is home to. I would like to especially recognize the competent, eager and friendly concierge staff - though truly every staff member at Principe di Savoia is completely on their game. The valet team is particularly strong as well. Beautiful rooms, a fine location - simply perfection. And, yes, the service has everything to do with it. Congratulations to management for such a sterling operation. One of the world's best hotels.
reviews.title: One of my favorite hotels (yes, in the world)

reviews.text: A really luxurious grand hotel. I stayed there during the winter sales, and Milan as well as the Principe di Savoia was overrun with nouveau riche shoppers from Eastern Europe. Staff throughout my stay were very friendly and helpful, whether the receptionists at check-in, the gym or the staff at breakfast. The room was fresh and very nicely appointed, with lovely soft furnishings, a marble-clad bathroom and great toiletries. If I had to criticise anything, it would perhaps be that the mattress and pillows were too firm for my taste. Very elegant foyer and restaurant. The breakfast buffet was very good, with a wide choice and quality ingredients. The gym and pool area on the top floor was also great. It's an easy 10 minute walk to the shopping area and centre, but I used the limousine service a few times, which was very convenient. Overall a fantastic hotel of which I have fond memories.
reviews.title: True grand hotel
My birthday at "Principe di Savoia" Milano,Italy
reviews.text: Beautiful Palace in Milano, gorgeous spa and pool on the roof, take a Mosaic suite it's great, I appreciate the limousine shuttle for a free ride to downtown? From the concierge staff to the room and the breakfast room service, everything is perfect !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is really excellent and worth having 5 stars !! The rooms are very big for a city hotel, the service in the whole hotel is top, the restaurant serves a fine and healthy kitchen, the bar has a very nice atmosphere, the concierge will always help you in a very professional way and the hotel gives a free shuttle to the shopping district and the Duomo and back.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with top service !

reviews.text: The only disappointing point : we asked for a non smoking and quiet room and we got a room where they had smoked (window was also opened by house keeping) and there were matches and ashtrays in the room. The room was also next to a street with a tram.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: An excellent hotel! Rooms were refurbished to a very high standard and the room size is good for Milan. Service is faultless too. Only downside is the breakfast is horrible, especially for the high asking price. Processed sausages and stale breads, and no toaster! Still a 5* hotel I would gladly come back to though
reviews.title: Excellence in Milan

reviews.text: The glamour of the 80's is gone. The hotel went under a lot of renovation. Rooms (most of them very spacious) have been redone. I stayed at the hotel 3 times since July.
reviews.title: One of the best in Milano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't enjoy the room of my last stay. Lights in the room are too bright and very complicated to
reviews.title: Perfect summer break!

reviews.text: operate.impractical not because it is new technology, but not well thought out.
reviews.title: Perfect but pricey

reviews.text: furnitures are copies of the old one without the charm and the quality. Great bathroom
reviews.title: $680 per night

reviews.text: Restaurant....very good
reviews.title: Milanese Star Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff have found out that we are newly-weds and arranged a room upgrade, champaign and wedding gift! This was amazing! The hotel itself is very posh, top quality service and food, the room is acomplished in mild colours with satin and wodden walls, red and mixed wood furniture, it is also complimeted with stereo system and other hi-tech features.
reviews.title: ALL PERFECT

reviews.text: Thanks!
reviews.title: Another fabulous experience at the PdS

reviews.text: MOHAMMED
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Three years after my last visit to the Principe di Savoia I returned with my wife to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel had been refurbished in areas but has lost none of it's original charm and opulence. Our room was gorgeous, tasteful and bristling with every possible convenience. The location is a mile or two away from the centre of Milan but the hotel offers a free limousine service throughout the day. If I had a grumble it would be the price of drinks in the bar - €20 plus for a G&T curtailed our celebrations with friends somewhat but I suppose these prices aren't too unfamiliar to people who visit or live in Milan. All in all our stay was a luxurious and hugely enjoyable experience in one of Europe's great hotels.
reviews.title: Still one of the best hotels in the world...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is so amazing. The staff is absolutely wonderful. They greeted us so warmly when we checked in. We were walked up to our suite, and explained all the amenities of the hotel along the way. The room was amazing...we had a one bedroom suite. Beautiful decor, warm, comfortable feel to the room. The beds are very comfortable. The bathroom was huge! The shower was great with 3 different shower heads, the hair dryer was hot and powerful and the lighting was really good as well.
reviews.title: Luxury Stay Milan

description: Rich in tradition, the Principe di Savoia –one of the Dorchester Collection– is amongst Europe’s most famous hotels. It offers a winning combination of Old World luxury, latest technology and design innovations. With its 401 exclusive accommodations and 13 modular meeting rooms the hotel boasts a spectacular location for your congresses and events. Facilities: - Acanto restaurant with its exceptional show kitchen; - Club 10, the wonderful rooftop Spa, pool and fitness center; - Principe Bar and Il Salotto lounge, fashionable Milanese hot spots.
